Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction
Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey A Leiskau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.
No contact with J.R. unless authorized by agent.

Assessment, counseling, and treatment as deemed appropriate by the dept. SAFE program follow through. May transfer probation to county of residence.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Current: 601 E Pioneer Ave, Wittenberg, WI 54499 United States  (Effective: 11-29-2016)

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 3:01 pm 
INCLUDES 16CF619, 15CF461, AND 15CF1067. 
State appears by ADA Matt Adrian; Def appears in person with Atty Pauline Toulouse. 
OTR: 3:05 pm BOTR: 3:08 pm 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
In 16CF619: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (OAR/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF461: Ct. 3 (Knowingly Violate a DA Order - Injunction/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Knowingly Violate a DA Order - Injunction/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF1067: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                      : Ct. 2 (Criminal Trespass to Dwelling/DA/DA Repeater/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF461: Ct. 1 (Criminal Damage to Property/DA Repeater/Repeater/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Knowingly Violate a DA Order - Injunction/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CF1067: Ct. 3 (Knowingly Violate a DA Order - Injunction/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                      : Ct. 4 (Knowingly Violate a DA Order - Injunction/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
Argument re: conditional jail. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS ON ALL>>SAFE program assessment and follow through; assessment/counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; no contact with J.R. unless authorized by agent; DNA sample and surcharge; CC including 1 DA surcharge. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITION on Ct. 3 in 15CF1067>>180 days MCJ imposed and STAYED. 
COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit at this time - COURT notes parties may submit stipulation re: credit.  
COURT authorizes transfer of probation to def's home County.

Plea/sentencing hearing on November 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
